member.name: T:OpenTok.AudioDevice
member.summary: A class that includes methods for setting the audio device to be used by publishers and subscribers.

member.summary: Represents an input audio device (such as a microphone) available on the Windows system. See and .

member.name: P:OpenTok.AudioDevice.InputAudioDevice.Id
member.summary: The ID of the device.

member.summary: Returns a list of available audio input devices on the system.
member.returns: A list of InputAudioDevice objects, representing available Audio input devices on the system.

member.summary: Sets the input audio device to be used by all publishers. See .

member.summary: Sets an instance of the interface as the virtual audio device for a custom audio driver used by all publishers and subscribers.

members.member: An audio bus used for all publisher and subscribers.
Reads audio data from subscriber audio streams to be rendered.
Writes audio data (to publishers) to be captured and sent in the audio stream.

The number of channels of the audio device.

member.name: T:OpenTok.IAudioDevice
member.summary: Defines an Audio device to be used by all publishers and subscribers.

member.name: M:OpenTok.IAudioDevice.InitAudio(OpenTok.AudioDevice.AudioBus)
member.summary: Called when the AudioDevice is initialized. Use the AudioBus object to read write audio data. Call the AudioBus.ReadRenderData(IntPtr buffer, int numberOfSamples) and AudioBus.WriteCaptureData(IntPtr buffer, int numberOfSamples) methods to read render data from subscribers and write capture data to publishers.
member.param: The instance of the AudioBus to use for all publishers and subscribers.

member.summary: Called when the audio capturer starts. You should begin providing audio samples to the AudioBus.WriteCaptureData(IntPtr buffer, int numberOfSamples) method.

member.name: M:OpenTok.IAudioDevice.StopAudioCapturer
member.summary: Called when the audio capturer stops.

member.name: T:OpenTok.IceConfig
member.summary: A class for setting custom ICE configuration.
member.remarks: This is used for the configurable TURN feature. Pass this in as the iceConfig parameter of the constructor.

member.summary: The constructor for IceConfig object passed into the constructor.
member.param: A list of IceServer objects, representing custom TURN servers to be used by the client.
Whether to use all ICE transport types (such as host, srflx, and TURN) to establish media connectivity or to only use TURN.
Whether to use only the custom servers or both OpenTok servers and the custom servers.

members.member: The list of IceServer objects, representing custom TURN servers to be used by the client.
Whether to use all ICE transport types (such as host, srflx, and TURN) to establish media connectivity or to only use TURN.
Whether to use only the custom servers or both OpenTok servers and the custom servers.

member.name: T:OpenTok.VideoCapturer
member.summary: A video capturer implementation that captures video from on of the cameras available on the system.
member.remarks:
Use VideoCapturer.EnumerateDevices() to get a list of available video devices (cameras). Use one of the CreateVideoCapturer() methods of the VideoDevice class to instantiate a VideoCapturer object.
The VideoCapturer class implements the System.IDisposable interface. Be sure to call the method of the VideoCapturer object to release its resources when you no longer need the object (for example, when the Publisher using the capturer is removed or when the app or window is closing).

member.name: T:OpenTok.VideoCapturer.Resolution
member.summary: Enumerates common pre-defined video resolutions.

member.name: F:OpenTok.VideoCapturer.Resolution.Low
member.summary: The lowest available camera capture resolution supported in the OpenTok Windows SDK (320x240) or the closest resolution supported on the system.

member.name: F:OpenTok.VideoCapturer.Resolution.Medium
member.summary: VGA resolution (640x480) or the closest resolution supported on the system.

member.name: F:OpenTok.VideoCapturer.Resolution.High
member.summary: The highest available camera capture resolution supported in the OpenTok Windows SDK (1280x720) or the closest resolution supported on the system.

member.name: T:OpenTok.VideoCapturer.FrameRate
member.summary: Enumerates common pre-defined video frame rates.

member.name: F:OpenTok.VideoCapturer.FrameRate.Fps7
member.summary: 7 frames per second.

member.name: F:OpenTok.VideoCapturer.FrameRate.Fps1
member.summary: 1 frame1 per second.

The height of the video, in pixels.
The frame rate of the video, in frames per second.

member.summary: Creates a video capturer that uses the provided resolution and frame rate. The video capturer will use the closest available settings.
member.param: The resolution of the video, as defined by values in the Resolution enum.

member.name: T:OpenTok.Connection
member.summary: Represents a connection between a client and an OpenTok session.
member.remarks:
The Session.Connection property is set to a Connection object that represents the local user's connection. The Stream.Connection property is set to a Connection object that represents the stream publisher's connection. To initialize a session, call the
constructor, which returns the Session object. Then call the method to connect to the session. When the connection to the session is made, the Session object sends the event.
When streams connect to a session, the Session object sends the event. Compare the connection property of a Stream object with the connection property of the Session object to determine if a stream is published by your client or another.

member.name: M:OpenTok.Connection.#ctor(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: For internal use only.

member.name: M:OpenTok.Connection.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes of the Connection object's resources.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Connection.Id
member.summary: The unique ID for this connection.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Connection.Data
member.summary: A string containing metadata describing the connection. You can add this connection data when you create a token.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Connection.CreationTime
member.summary: Returns the time at which the connection was created on the OpenTok server.

member.name: T:OpenTok.Stream
member.summary: Represents an audio-video stream in an OpenTok session.
member.remarks:
The Session object sends the event when there is a new stream in the session.
The Session sends a event when a stream is dropped from the session (for example, when it is unpublished).

member.name: M:OpenTok.Stream.#ctor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: For internal use.

member.summary: Disposes of the Stream object's resources.

member.summary: The name of the stream. You can display this name to identify the stream's publisher.

member.summary: Whether this stream has video (true) or not (false).

member.name: P:OpenTok.Stream.HasVideo
member.summary: Whether this stream has video (true) or not (false).

member.name: P:OpenTok.Stream.Width
member.summary: The width of the video from this stream.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Stream.Height
member.summary: The height of the video from this stream.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Stream.CreationTime
member.summary: The creation time of this stream.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Stream.VideoSourceType
member.summary: The video source type of the stream (either camera or screen sharing), as defined by the OpenTok.VideoSourceType enum.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Stream.Connection
member.summary: The Connection object corresponding to the client that is publishing the stream.

member.name: T:OpenTok.Context
member.summary: Used to manage resources for , , and objects.
member.remarks: Call the method to dispose of the all OpenTok resources used in the context.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Context.Instance
member.summary: The Context instance. This is a singleton instance. However it is reset to a new instance after you call the method.

member.name: M:OpenTok.Context.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes of the all OpenTok resources used in the current context. Call this after you call to clean up unused resources.

member.name: T:OpenTok.Capabilities
member.summary: Defines values for the Capabilities property of a Session object, based on the role assigned to the token used to connect to the session.
member.remarks: See the Token creation overview.

members.member: The client can publish and subscribe to streams.
The client can subscribe to streams, but cannot publish streams.

member.name: T:OpenTok.IceServer

member.remarks: An IceServer object represents a custom TURN server to be used by the client.

member.summary: The constructor. The URL for the custom TURN server. The username for the TURN server. ThisThe credential string for the TURN server.

The username for the TURN server.

member.name: T:OpenTok.ICEIncludeServers
member.summary: Defines values for the IncludeServers property of the IceConfig class.

member.name: T:OpenTok.ICETransport
member.summary: Defines values for the TransportPolicy property of the IceConfig class.

member.name: T:OpenTok.Session
member.summary: Represents an OpenTok session in which the client is participating.
member.remarks:
The first step in using the OpenTok Windows SDK is to instantiate a Session object using the Session.Builder class.
The Session class implements the System.IDisposable interface. Be sure to call the method of the Session object to release its resources when you no longer need the object (for example, when the app or window is closing).
See also Session Creation and Token Creation.

member.summary: Defines arguments for the and events.

member.summary: The connection related to the event.

member.summary: Defines arguments for the event.

member.summary: The error code.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Session.ErrorEventArgs.ErrorDescription
member.summary: The error description.

member.summary: The type string of the signal.

member.summary: The signal data.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Session.SignalEventArgs.Connection
member.summary: The connection identifying the client that sent the signal. This value can be null.

member.summary: Defines arguments for the and events.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Session.StreamEventArgs.Stream
member.summary: The stream related to the event.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Session.ArchiveStoppedEventArgs.ArchiveId
member.summary: The archive ID.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Session.Connected
member.summary: Sent when the client connects to the OpenTok session.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Session.Disconnected
member.summary: Sent when the client disconnects from the OpenTok session.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Session.ConnectionCreated
member.summary: Sent when another client connects to the session.
member.remarks: The object represents the client's connection to the session. Note that this method is invoked when other clients connect to the session. When your own client client connects, the Session sends the event.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Session.ConnectionDropped
member.summary: Sent when another client leaves the session.
member.remarks: The object represents the client's previous connection to the session. Note that this method is called when other clients leave the session. When your own client client disconnects, the Session object sends the event.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Session.StreamReceived
member.summary: Sent when a there is a new stream published by another client in this OpenTok session.
member.remarks: The object represents the new stream. Create a and call the method to subscribe to the stream.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Session.StreamDropped
member.summary: Sent when another client stops publishing a stream to this OpenTok session.
member.remarks: The represents the dropped stream, which can be used to identify a corresponding Subscriber (if there is one).

member.name: E:OpenTok.Session.Error
member.summary: Sent when something goes wrong when connecting or connected to the session.
member.remarks: This event is sent if the attempt to connect to the session fails. It is also sent if the connection to the session drops due to an error after a successful connection, and in this case the event is sent just before the event is sent.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Session.Signal
member.summary: Called when a signal is received in the session.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Session.StreamHasAudioChanged
member.summary: Called when a stream in the session changes between having audio and not having audio.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Session.StreamHasVideoChanged
member.summary: Called when a stream in the session changes between having video and not having video.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Session.StreamDimensionsChanged
member.summary: Called when the video dimensions of a stream in the session change.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Session.ReconnectionStart
member.summary: Sent when the local client has lost its connection to an OpenTok session and is trying to reconnect. This results from a loss in network connectivity.
member.remarks:
If the client can reconnect to the session, the Session object sends the event. Otherwise, if the client cannot reconnect, the Session object sends the event.
In response to this method being called, you may want to provide a user interface notification, to let the user know that the app is trying to reconnect to the session and that audio-video streams are temporarily disconnected.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Session.ReconnectionSuccess
member.summary: Invoked when the local client has reconnected to the OpenTok session after its network connection was lost temporarily.
member.remarks:
When the connection is lost, the Session object sends the Session.ReconnectionStart event, prior to sending the Session.ReconnectionSuccess event. If the client cannot reconnect to the session, the Session object sends the Session.Disconnected event.
Any existing publishers and subscribers are automatically reconnected when the client reconnects and this method is called.
By default, any signals initiated by the the local client using the method are sent when the client reconnects. To prevent any signals initiated while disconnected from being sent, set the retryAfterReconnect parameter of the method to false. (All signals sent by other clients while your client was disconnected are received upon reconnecting.)

member.name: E:OpenTok.Session.ArchiveStarted
member.summary: Called when an archive of the session starts recording. In response to this method, you may want to add a user interface notification (such as an icon in the Publisher view) that indicates the session is being recorded.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Session.ArchiveStopped
member.summary: Called when an archive of the session stops being recorded. In response to this method, you may want to remove a user interface notification (such as an icon in the Publisher view) the session recording has stopped.

member.name: T:OpenTok.Session.Builder
member.summary: Used to create a Session instance.
member.remarks: Instantiate a Builder instance by calling the Builder() constructor. Then (optionally), set properties of the Builder object. Then call the Build() method to create a Session object.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Session.Builder.ConnectionEventsSuppressed
member.summary: Prevent connection events (such as from being dispatched. The default value is false.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Session.Builder.IpWhitelist

member.name: P:OpenTok.Session.Builder.SessionId
member.summary: The OpenTok session ID this instance should connect to. For test purposes, you can generate test session by logging into your TokBox account. Use the OpenTok server SDKs to generate session IDs in your shipping application.

member.name: M:OpenTok.Session.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes of the Session object's resources.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Session.Connection
member.summary: Returns the Connection corresponding to this client's connection to this Session.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Session.Capabilities
member.summary: Whether the client can only subscribe to streams, or both publish and subscribe to streams, based on the role assigned to the token used to connect to the session.

member.name: M:OpenTok.Session.Connect(System.String)
member.summary: Connects to the OpenTok session provided in the Session constructor, using the provided authentication token.
member.remarks:
When the session connects, the Session object sends the event.
If the session fails to connect, the Session objecdt sends the event.
member.param: The token for the user. See Token Creation Overview.

member.name: M:OpenTok.Session.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnects from this session. All Subscriber and Publisher instances will be disconnected.
member.remarks: When the session disconnects, the Session sends the event.

member.name: M:OpenTok.Session.SendSignal(System.String,System.String,OpenTok.Connection,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends a signal to all clients in the session.
member.param: The type of the signal. The type is set in the argument of the event listener.
The data to send. The limit to the size of data is 8kB. The type is set in the argument of the event listener.

member.name: M:OpenTok.Session.Subscribe(OpenTok.Subscriber)
member.summary: Start receiving and rendering audio-video stream data for the specified subscriber.
member.param: The subscriber bound to the stream to be received.

member.name: M:OpenTok.Session.Unsubscribe(OpenTok.Subscriber)
member.summary: Stops subscribing (receiving a stream) to a specified subscriber in the session.
member.param: The Subcriber you want to stop subscribing to.

member.name: M:OpenTok.Session.Publish(OpenTok.Publisher)
member.summary: Starts a Publisher streaming to the session.
member.param: The Publisher that you want to stream to the session.

member.name: M:OpenTok.Session.Unpublish(OpenTok.Publisher)
member.summary: Disconnects the Publisher from the session.
member.param: The Publisher to unpublish.

member.name: T:OpenTok.ErrorCode
member.summary: Defines error code values for OpenTokException objects.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.UnknownError
member.summary: Used for an unknown error.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.GenericSDKError
member.summary: Used for generic error. See provided error description.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.AuthorizationFailure
member.summary: An invalid API key or token was provided.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.InvalidSessionId
member.summary: Unable to connect: an invalid session ID was provided.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.ConnectionFailed
member.summary: The session failed to connect.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.NoMessagingServer
member.summary: There was an error connecting to the OpenTok messaging server.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.ConnectionRefused
member.summary: A socket could not be opened to OpenTok the messaging server. Check that outbound ports 443 and 8080 are accessible.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.SessionStateFailed
member.summary: The connection timed out while attempting to get the session's state. Check the network connection.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.P2PSessionMaxParticipants
member.summary: A peer-to-peer enabled session can only have two participants.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.SessionConnectionTimeout
member.summary: The connection timed out while attempting to connect to the session. Check the network connection.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.SessionInternalError
member.summary: Internal error connecting to the session. Try connecting again.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.SessionInvalidSignalType
member.summary: Invalid signal type.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.SessionSignalDataTooLong
member.summary: Invalid signal -- the data string is too long. The maximum length is 8196.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.SessionSignalTypeTooLong
member.summary: Invalid signal -- the type string is too long. The maximum length is 128.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.ConnectionDropped
member.summary: The connection to the OpenTok messaging server was dropped. Check the network connection.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.SessionDisconnected
member.summary: Attempting to publish to a disconnected session.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.PublisherInternalError
member.summary: Internal error when publishing. Try publishing again.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.PublisherWebRTCError
member.summary: Publisher WebRTC failure.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.PublisherUnableToPublish
member.summary: The publisher is unable to publish.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.PublisherUnexpectedPeerConnectionDisconnection
member.summary: The PeerConnection for the publisher's stream unexpectedly disconnected.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.PublisherCannotAccessCamera
member.summary: The publisher cannot access the specified camera.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.PublisherCameraAccessDenied
member.summary: The user denied access to the camera.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.ConnectionTimedOut
member.summary: Subscriber timed out while attempting to connect to the stream. Try resubscribing to the stream.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.SubscriberSessionDisconnected
member.summary: Attempting to subscribe to a stream in a session that you have disconnected from.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.SubscriberWebRTCError
member.summary: Subscriber WebRTC failure.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.SubscriberServerCannotFindStream
member.summary: The subscriber failed due to the stream being missing. This can happen if the subscriber is created at the same time the stream is removed from the session.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.SubscriberStreamLimitExceeded
member.summary: The subscriber failed due to the the limit to the number of subscribers the servers support.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.SubscriberInternalError
member.summary: Internal error when subscribing. Try subscribing again.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.UnknownPublisherInstance
member.summary: Cannot unpublish: An unknown Publisher instance was passed into the method.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.UnknownSubscriberInstance
member.summary: Cannot unsubscribe: An unknown Subscriber instance was passed into the method.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.SessionNullOrInvalidParameter
member.summary: You passed an invalid parameter or the Session is null.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.VideoCaptureFailed
member.summary: There was an error in the video capturer.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.CameraFailed
member.summary: There was an error in acquiring video from the camera.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.VideoRenderFailed
member.summary: There was an error in the video renderer.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.SessionSubscriberNotFound
member.summary: The subscriber is unknown to this session. This is usually the result of calling with a subscriber that is not associated with the session.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.SessionPublisherNotFound
member.summary: The publisher is unknown to this session. This is usually the result of calling with a publisher that is not publishing a stream to the session.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.PublisherTimeout
member.summary: Timeout while attempting to publish.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.SessionBlockedCountry
member.summary: Unable to connect to the session. Terms of service violation: export compliance.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.SessionConnectionLimitExceeded
member.summary: The connection failed due to the the limit to the number of connections the servers support.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.SessionUnexpectedGetSessionInfoResponse
member.summary: Unable to connect to the session. Try connecting again.

member.name: F:OpenTok.ErrorCode.SessionIllegalState
member.summary: Unable to connect to a session that is already connected. Or unable to subscribe to a stream that is no longer in the session.

member.name: T:OpenTok.OpenTokException

member.remarks: Check the and Message properties for details on the error.

member.name: M:OpenTok.OpenTokException.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: For internal use only.

member.name: M:OpenTok.OpenTokException.#ctor(OpenTok.ErrorCode)
member.summary: For internal use only.

member.name: F:OpenTok.OpenTokException.ErrorCode
member.summary: The error code. See the OpenTok.ErrorCode enum.

member.name: T:OpenTok.Subscriber
member.summary: Used to consume an audio-video stream in the OpenTok session.
member.remarks:
Use the Subscriber.Builder class to create a Subscriber instance. Subscribers can connect to receive media when you call the method.
The Subscriber class implements the System.IDisposable interface. Be sure to call the method of the Subscriber object to release its resources when you no longer need the object (for example, when the Subscriber stops streaming video or when the app or window is closing).

member.name: T:OpenTok.Subscriber.VideoReason
member.summary: Defines values for the and properties.

member.name: F:OpenTok.Subscriber.VideoReason.PublishVideo
member.summary: The event occured because the publisher of the stream started or stopped publishing video.

member.name: F:OpenTok.Subscriber.VideoReason.SubscriberToVideo
member.summary: The event occured because the local client started or stopped subscribing to video.

member.name: F:OpenTok.Subscriber.VideoReason.Quality
member.summary: The video event was caused by a change to the video stream quality.
member.remarks:
Stream quality may change due to network conditions or CPU usage on either the subscriber or publisher.
This reason is only used in sessions that have the media mode set to "routed". (See The OpenTok Media Router and media modes. This feature of the OpenTok Media Router has a subscriber drop the video stream when the video stream quality degrades, and the Subscriber sends the event. When conditions improve, the video stream resumes, and the Subscriber sends the event.
When the video stream is dropped, the subscriber continues to receive the audio stream, if there is one.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Subscriber.Stream
member.summary: The Stream corresponding to this subscriber.

member.name: T:OpenTok.Subscriber.ErrorEventArgs
member.summary: Defines arguments for the event.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Subscriber.ErrorEventArgs.ErrorCode
member.summary: The error code.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Subscriber.ErrorEventArgs.ErrorDescription
member.summary: The error description.

member.name: T:OpenTok.Subscriber.VideoEventArgs
member.summary: Defines arguments for the and events.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Subscriber.VideoEventArgs.Reason
member.summary: The reason that the video track was started (or resumed).
member.remarks: This is set to a value defined by the OpenTok.Subscriber.VideoReason enum: PublishVideo, SubscribeToVideo, or Quality.

member.name: T:OpenTok.Subscriber.AudioNetworkStatsEventArgs
member.summary: Defines arguments for events.

members.member: The total number of audio packets lost by the subscriber.
The total number of audio packets received by the subscriber.
The total number of audio bytes received by the subscriber.
The timestamp for when these stats were gathered.

member.name: T:OpenTok.Subscriber.VideoNetworkStatsEventArgs
member.summary: Defines arguments for events.

members.member: The total number of video packets lost by the subscriber.
The total number of video packets received by the subscriber.
The total number of video bytes received by the subscriber.
The timestamp for when these stats were gathered.

member.name: T:OpenTok.Subscriber.AudioLevelArgs
member.summary: Defines arguments for events.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Subscriber.AudioLevelArgs.AudioLevel
member.summary: The audio level, from 0 to 1.0. Adjust this value logarithmically for use in a user interface visualization (such as a volume meter).

member.name: E:OpenTok.Subscriber.Connected
member.summary: Invoked when the instance has successfully connected to the stream and begins playing media.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Subscriber.StreamDisconnected
member.summary: Called when the subscriber's stream has been interrupted.
member.remarks:
In response to this method being called, you may want to provide a user interface notification, to let the user know that the audio-video stream is temporarily disconnected and the app is trying to reconnect to the stream.
If the client reconnects to the stream, the Subscribers sends the event. Otherwise, the Session object sends the event.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Subscriber.StreamReconnected
member.summary: Sent when the subscriber's stream resumes (after temporarily being disconnected).
member.remarks: The Subscriber sends this event after it sends the event.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Subscriber.VideoDisabled
member.summary: Called when the subscriber stops receiving video.
member.remarks: Check the reason property of the event arguments for the reason why the video stopped.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Subscriber.VideoEnabled
member.summary: Called when the subscriber's video stream starts (when there previously was no video) or resumes (after video was disabled).
member.remarks: Check the reason property of the event arguments for the reason why the video was enabled.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Subscriber.Error
member.summary: Invoked when a subscriber has failed to connect to the OpenTok server.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Subscriber.VideoDisableWarning
member.summary: Called when the OpenTok Media Router determines that the stream quality has degraded and the video will be disabled if the quality degrades further.
member.remarks:
If the quality degrades further, the subscriber disables the video and the Subscriber sends the VideoDisabled message. If the stream quality improves, the Subscriber sends the VideoDisableWarningLifted event.
This feature is only available in sessions that use the OpenTok Media Router (sessions with the media mode set to routed), not in sessions with the media mode set to relayed. (See The OpenTok Media Router and media modes).
This method is mainly called when connection quality degrades.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Subscriber.VideoDisableWarningLifted
member.summary: Called when the OpenTok Media Router determines that the stream quality has improved to the point at which the video being disabled is not an immediate risk.
member.remarks:
This feature is only available in sessions that use the OpenTok Media Router (sessions with the media mode set to routed), not in sessions with the media mode set to relayed. (See The OpenTok Media Router and media modes).
This method is mainly called when connection quality improves.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Subscriber.AudioStatsUpdated
member.summary: Invoked when the subscriber has audio stats to share.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Subscriber.VideoStatsUpdated
member.summary: Invoked when the subscriber has video stats to share.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Subscriber.AudioLevel
member.summary: Sent periodically to report the audio level of the subscriber.

member.summary: Used to create a Subscriber instance.
member.remarks: Instantiate a Builder instance by calling the Builder() constructor. Then (optionally), set properties of the Builder object. Then call the Build() method to create a Subscriber object.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Subscriber.Builder.Renderer

member.summary: The Content object used to manage resources for the Subscriber.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Subscriber.Builder.Stream

member.param: The Context to use for the Subscriber object.
The Stream object corresponding to the stream you will subscribe to.

member.name: M:OpenTok.Subscriber.Builder.Build
member.summary: Use parameters in the builder instance to create a Subscriber object

member.name: M:OpenTok.Subscriber.#ctor(OpenTok.Context,OpenTok.Stream,OpenTok.IVideoRenderer)
member.summary: Creates a new subscriber for a given stream.
member.param: The Content object used to manage resources for the Subscriber.
The Stream object corresponding to the stream you will subscribe to.
The video renderer for the subscriber. If you do not specify a renderer, the video isn't rendered (and only audio is played back).

member.name: M:OpenTok.Subscriber.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes of the Subscriber object's resources.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Subscriber.SubscribeToAudio
member.summary: Whether the Subscriber is subscribing to audio (true) or not (false).

member.name: P:OpenTok.Subscriber.SubscribeToVideo
member.summary: Whether the Subscriber is subscribing to video (true) or not (false).

member.name: P:OpenTok.Subscriber.VideoRenderer
member.summary: The video renderer used by this subscriber.
member.remarks: Set the video renderer by passing in the VideoRenderer when calling the constructor.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Subscriber.Id
member.summary: The unique identifier for the Subscriber.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Subscriber.PreferredResolution
member.summary: The preferred resolution for the subscribers stream.
member.remarks:
The preferred resolution for the subscriber's stream.
Limiting the video resolution and frame rate () reduces the network and CPU usage on the subscribing client. You may want to use lower resolution based on the dimensions of subscriber's video in the app. You may want to use a lower frame rate or resolution for subscribers to a stream that is less important (and smaller) than other streams.
This property only applies when subscribing to a stream that uses the scalable video feature. Scalable video is available:
Only in sessions that use the OpenTok Media Router (sessions with the media mode set to routed).
Only for streams published by clients that support scalable video (see the documentation for the scalable video feature).
In streams that do not use scalable video, setting this property has no effect.
Note: The resolution for scalable video streams automatically adjusts for each subscriber, based on network conditions and CPU usage, even if you do not set this property. Set this property if you want to set a maximum resolution for this subscriber.
Not every resolution is available to a subscriber. When you set the preferred resolution, the OpenTok Windows SDK picks the best resolution available that matches your constraints. The resolutions available depend on the maximum width and height the Publisher sets for the stream, which are returned by the Stream.Width and Stream.Height properties of the Stream object. Each of the resolutions available for a stream will use the same aspect ratio.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Subscriber.PreferredFramerate
member.summary: The preferred framerate for the subscribers stream.
member.remarks:
Limiting the frame rate and video resolution () reduces the network and CPU usage on the subscribing client. You may want to use lower resolution based on the dimensions of subscriber's video in the app. You may want to use a lower frame rate or resolution for subscribers to a stream that is less important (and smaller) than other streams.
This property only applies when subscribing to a stream that uses the scalable video feature. Scalable video is available:
Only in sessions that use the OpenTok Media Router (sessions with the media mode set to routed).
Only for streams published by clients that support scalable video (see the documentation for the scalable video feature).
In streams that do not use scalable video, setting this property has no effect.
Note: The frame rate for scalable video streams automatically adjusts for each subscriber, based on network conditions and CPU usage, even if you do not set this property. Set this property if you want to set a maximum frame rate for this subscriber.
The frame rates available are based on the value of the maximum frame rate available for the stream. When you set the preferred frame rate for the subscriber, the OpenTok Windows SDK picks the best frame rate available that is closest to the preferred frame rate, based on the client's bandwidth and CPU constraints.
The actual frame rates available depend, dynamically, on network and CPU resources available to the publisher.

member.name: T:OpenTok.PixelFormat
member.summary: The format of a video frame.

members.member: Unknown format
YUV420p
NV12
NV21
YUY2
UYVY
32-bit ARGB
32-bit BGRA
24-bit RGB
32-bit ABGR
M-JPEG

member.name: T:OpenTok.Publisher
member.summary: A publisher captures an audio-video stream from the sources you specify.
member.remarks:
Use the Publisher.Builder class to create a Publisher instance. You can then publish the audio-video stream to an OpenTok session by calling the method.
The Publisher class implements the System.IDisposable interface. Be sure to call the method of the Publisher object to release its resources when you no longer need the object (for example, when the Publisher is removed or when the app or window is closing).

member.name: T:OpenTok.Publisher.Builder
member.summary: Used to create a Publisher instance.
member.remarks: Instantiate a Builder instance by calling the Builder() constructor. Then (optionally), set properties of the Builder object. Then call the Build() method to create a Publisher object.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Publisher.Builder.Capturer
member.summary: The video capturer to use for this publisher. If you do not specify a capturer, the Publisher uses the default video capturer, defined by the VideoCapturer class. This video capturer uses the first video device in the list of devices available on the system.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Publisher.Builder.Name
member.summary: The name of the publisher video. The property for a stream published by this publisher will be set to this value (on all clients).

member.name: P:OpenTok.Publisher.Builder.Renderer
member.summary: The video renderer to use for this publisher. If you do not specify a renderer, the video isn't rendered locally.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Publisher.Builder.HasAudioTrack
member.summary: Whether to include an audio track in the published stream.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Publisher.Builder.HasVideoTrack
member.summary: Whether to include an video track in the published stream.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Publisher.Builder.Stereo
member.summary: Whether to enable stereo audio in the published stream.

members.member: The total number of audio packets lost by the publisher.

member.name: T:OpenTok.Publisher.AudioNetworkStatsEventArgs
member.summary: Defines arguments for events.

member.name: F:OpenTok.Publisher.AudioNetworkStatsEventArgs.Stats
member.summary: An array of objects defining the current audio statistics for the publisher. For a publisher in a routed session (one that uses the OpenTok Media Router), this array includes one object, defining the statistics for the single audio-media stream that is sent to the OpenTok Media Router. In a relayed session, the array includes an object for each subscriber to the published stream.

member.name: T:OpenTok.Publisher.VideoNetworkStats
member.summary: Defines a video statistics object for the Stats property of a object.

member.name: F:OpenTok.Publisher.VideoNetworkStats.ConnectionId
member.summary: The connection ID of the subscribing client (in a routed session).

member.name: F:OpenTok.Publisher.VideoNetworkStats.SubscriberId
member.summary: The ID of the subscribing client's subscriber to the stream (in a relayed session).
member.remarks: In a routed session, this is an empty string.

members.member: The total number of video packets lost by the publisher.
The total number of video packets sent by the publisher.
The total number of video bytes sent by the publisher.
The timestamp for when these stats were gathered.
The timestamp from which the cumulative totals started accumulating.

member.name: T:OpenTok.Publisher.VideoNetworkStatsEventArgs
member.summary: Defines arguments for events.

member.name: F:OpenTok.Publisher.VideoNetworkStatsEventArgs.Stats
member.summary: An array of objects defining the current video statistics for the publisher. For a publisher in a routed session (one that uses the OpenTok Media Router), this array includes one object, defining the statistics for the single audio-media stream that is sent to the OpenTok Media Router. In a relayed session, the array includes an object for each subscriber to the published stream.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Publisher.StreamCreated
member.summary: Sent when the publisher's stream is created.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Publisher.StreamDestroyed
member.summary: Sent when the publisher's stream is destroyed.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Publisher.Error
member.summary: Sent when the publisher fails.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Publisher.AudioStatsUpdated
member.summary: Invoked when the publisher has audio stats to share. This is a beta feature.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Publisher.VideoStatsUpdated
member.summary: Invoked when the publisher has video stats to share. This is a beta feature.

member.name: E:OpenTok.Publisher.AudioLevel
member.summary: Sent periodically to report the audio level of the publisher.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Publisher.VideoRenderer
member.summary: The video renderer for the publisher.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Publisher.VideoCapturer
member.summary: The video capturer for the publisher.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Publisher.Stream
member.summary: The stream object corresponding the the Publisher's stream.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Publisher.PublishAudio
member.summary: Whether the publisher is publishing audio.

member.name: P:OpenTok.Publisher.VideoSourceType
member.summary: The type of the stream (either camera or screen sharing), as defined by the OpenTok.VideoSourceType enum.

member.name: M:OpenTok.Publisher.#ctor(OpenTok.Context,OpenTok.IVideoCapturer,System.String,OpenTok.IVideoRenderer,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new Publisher instance.
member.remarks: Use the method to start streaming from this publisher into a session.
member.param: The Context to use for this Publisher object.

The video capturer to use for this publisher. If you do not specify a capturer, the Publisher uses the default video capturer, defined by the VideoCapturer class. This video capturer uses the first video device in the list of devices available on the system.
The name of the publisher video. The property for a stream published by this publisher will be set to this value (on all clients).
The video renderer to use for this publisher. If you do not specify a renderer, the video isn't rendered locally.
Whether to include an audio track in the published stream.
Whether to include an video track in the published stream.
Whether to enable stereo audio in the published stream.

member.name: M:OpenTok.Publisher.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes of the Publisher object's resources.
member.remarks: Note that the Publisher's resources are not disposed of when you call the method. When you call , the resources of the Publisher object are retained so that you can reuse it (to Publish again to the session).
